Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Villain Pack #5 – Terror Through Time
Description:
The time-traveling villain Ransik has returned! Alongside his conniving rival and ally Frax, Ransik has brought together a squad of the fiercest villains from across time and space. This rogue’s gallery includes the wandering swordmaster Deker, the super mega evil Vrak, and the insectoid villainess Trakeena. Will they destroy the Power Rangers at long last?

—description from the publisher

Name: The Hunger: High Stakes
Description:
The Hunger: High Stakes expansion features exciting new twists for hungry vampires thanks to an event deck that creates random starting options. What's more, vampires can now attack, allowing them to defeat new threats, improve their hunting abilities, and take down other vampires.

—description from the publisher

Name: Transformers Deck-Building Game: Infiltration Protocol
Description:
Infiltrate. Escalate. Annihilate. The Decepticons have enacted the Infiltration Protocol: a six-stage plan to destabilize and conquer new worlds. Luckily, the Wreckers are here to stop them!

The Transformers Deck-Building Game: Infiltration Protocol expansion brings new cards and ways to play the game: one versus many, team versus team, and an objective-focused game mode, the Infiltration Phase Variant!

—description from the publisher

Name: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game – RPM – Get in Gear
Description:
Pedal to the Metal!
The Venjix computer virus has built armies of robots and taken over the world! The only thing that stands in the way are the Ranger Operators. Faster-than-ever gameplay includes new strategies such as building up RPM to penetrate your foe's defenses or draining their energy to leave them weakened!

This expansion requires the Power Rangers Deck-Building Game Core Set or Zeo – Stronger Than Before to play.

Features:
Over 75 new cards! 
Expansion: Requires Power Rangers Deck-Building Core Set or Zeo - Stronger Than Before to play

—description from the publisher

Name: Abstract Academy: Humpy Promo
Description:
Exclusive Professor card available from Crafty Games webstore.

Humpy Rules: 5 points for the most chaotic composition*

    As Balanced Composition, but highest result

Name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield Brilliant Stars
Description:
Overflowing with light, Arceus VSTAR descends from on high to share its celestial powers with other Pokémon V. Discover glimmering constellations and start your journey toward stellar greatness in the Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Brilliant Stars expansion!


     Over 170 cards
     4 brand-new Pokémon VSTAR
     20 powerful Pokémon V and 3 enormous Pokémon VMAX
     30 cards with special art in the Trainer Gallery subset
     More than 20 Trainer cards and a new Special Energy card


—description from the publisher

Name: Sherlock Holmes, Consulting Detective ー Baker Street 221B
Description:
In Sherlock Holmes, Consulting Detective - Baker Street 221B, detectives venture to the darkest parts of London trying to solve six different Sherlock Holmes cases.

On their turn, a player moves their detective piece one or two spaces on the board. Travelling from location to location, they collect clues to be the first to solve a case. Once all clues have been collected, the player must arrest the criminal before the case is finally solved. The game ends once all tiles have been removed from the board (or a player forces it to end), and the player with the most points wins.

Name: Bureau of Investigation: The Disappearance of a Student
Description:
Arkham, April 5, 1929.

Albert Copper, a local student, is reported missing, and your job is to find him.

This is a Demo Scenario for Bureau of Investigation: Investigations in Arkham & Elsewhere. It does not need any items from the base game.

Name: Warszawa 1920
Description:
The Battle of Warsaw is the largest Polish-Russian battle of 1920. The goal of Soviet Russia was to rekindle the flame of the revolution throughout Europe. The Polish counterattack from the Wieprz River completely changed the fate of the war. From that moment, the Soviets were in constant retreat and suffered many defeats in subsequent battles.

—description from the publisher

Warszawa 1920 is a game using WB-95 rule system. It contains three scenarios and 286 unit counters. Additional scenario was printed in TiS magazine nr.43.

—user summary
Families: Series: Wielkie Bitwy 1939-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Strategia)

Name: Cafe Rush: Table for Two
Description:
A two-player standalone expansion for Cafe Rush: a top speed, high energy, family-friendly card game that’s perfect for parties.

Don’t keep your customers waiting; serve the food they ordered as fast as you can!

In this fast & frantic card game, play table cards, then fill their orders by playing food cards onto them. The catch? Everyone can play on anyone's cards, and everyone plays at once!

Serve the most tables and play the most cards overall to score big points and get the "tip jar" bonus!

Name: Kingdom Frenzy
Description:
In a Kingdom ruled by a ruthless King, where peasants revolt, circus performers strike and lovers are left to die, can you fight for the throne and become the new ruler of this corrupted kingdom? Will you be able to escape the assassin while you secretly bring your coven together? Or will you fool around like the Jester and hinder the competition?

Kingdom Frenzy is a fun, slightly chaotic, hidden card party game for adults and teens. The average game time is about 20 minutes long and no two games will provide the same results.

The aim of this game is to have the highest scoring card at the end of the game.

Kingdom Frenzy is played using only a deck of cards. With 30 unique cards, including a King, Queen, Jester and many more, there are many ways to help you end with the highest card. Don't forget to watch out for that Assassin.

Kingdom Frenzy was printed by LudoCards, who print 'custom cards and games 100% made in Italy in ecological approach'

—description from the designer

Name: Guess what!
Description:
Gæt mig! consists of cards showing pictures. One player describes the picture in the card with mime (blue cards) or sounds (red cards). The other players try to guess the picture. Whoever guesses first wins the card. When the deck is empty, the player with most cards wins.

—user summary

Name: Fences: 5-6 player expansion
Description: Expansion for the game Fences to play with up to 6 players.

Name: Berliner Verkehr: Mit S + U-Bahn kreuz und quer
Description:
Each player gets 2 trains, which are placed on the depot in the lower left corner of the game board. The players take turns to roll the die and move their trains. On the roll of a 6, a player may take one of his trains to the starting space of the same color and letter. When a train reaches the ring track, it proceedes clockwise along the ring. If a train reaches an occupied station, the first train is taken back to it's starting space. Whenever a train reaches a transfer station that leads inside the ring, he may use connected the "S-Bahn" track as a shortcut.

Game variant 1: The players only use the "S-Bahn" tracks. The first player to get his 2 trains around the ring and back to his starting space wins the game.

Game variant 2: The players may also use the subway tracks inside the ring as shortcuts.

Game variant 3, 4 and 5: The players have to reach alternate destinations to win.

Game variant 6: Players that have made their way at least through half the ring may use a shortcut even if they don't land on a transfer station.

—user summary

Name: No Cheese, No Coin
Description:
No Cheese, No Coin: The card game for people who like Cheese & Money (who doesn’t?).

Do you like Money? Do you like Cheese?

If you answer yes to any of these questions, then this is the game for you!

No Cheese, No Coin is a quick easy to play card game designed for smaller groups of friends who are avid cheese and money enthusiasts. A simple design and dynamic gameplay makes the game fun and enjoyable for all players.

The objective of the game is very simple. Players need to collect coin cards from the deck. The player with the most coin cards within the time limit wins! However, the challenge is dealing with all the different cheese effects cards and the players that can either help or sabotage your chances.

Think smart, play cheesy and remember if you got no cheese then you can’t get no coin.

—description from the designer

Name: Yoin
Description:
Yoin is a drawless game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (cells) of an initially empty hexagonal grid of hexagons (board). Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.

				
				
					DefinitionsA group is a stone along with all other stones one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent stones of its color.

The size of a group is the number of stones in it.

				
				
					PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty cell. When the board is full, the winner is determined as follows:

1ï¸âƒ£ Let n equal 0.
2ï¸âƒ£ The player with fewer groups bigger than n stones wins.
3ï¸âƒ£ If no winner is found, increase n by 1 and go back to 2ï¸âƒ£.

The pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

—description from the designer

Name: Prehistories: Evolutions
Description:
Adds 4 evolutive modules to the base game.

Each module comes in a sealed envelope with a backstory and special rules/new gameplay elements.

Once all the modules are opened, you can mix and match them.

Name: Plan Escape
Description:
You wake up in a cold and quiet room with your best friends, there are several doors and an envelope on one wall. It says: “Welcome to the mansion, it's easy to get there. The challenge is to be able to get out, you don't have much time left."

In Escape Plan , the mansion can disappear at any time, all participants will strategically play their cards to get out before that happens.

The board will be assembled with the cards of the different places in the mansion that each of the participants play, and the characters move from one environment to another to escape.

Escape Plan offers two game options. Competitive, all players compete to come out first, and Cooperative, all participants will work together every move they make.

Name: 1877: Stockholm Tramways
Description:
In 1872 Stockholm Tramway Company was founded with the ambition of constructing tramways in Stockholm. Having failed to do so the company was dissolved in 1874 only to be founded again two years later under the new name Stockholm New Tramway Company. The new company was successful and on July 10, 1877, the first horse-drawn carriage traversed the streets of Stockholm. The tramway era had begun.

1877: Stockholm Tramways is a game in the 18xx series set in Stockholm. The players are investors in tramway companies during the late 19th century and the first half of the 20th century (1877 - 1966). In contrast to other games in the 18xx series, 1877 allows players to perform hostile takeovers under certain circumstances.

—description from the designer

Name: Bird of the Year
Description:
Each year in New Zealand there is a competition to vote for the most popular bird - this is to help raise awareness for some of the worlds most endangered wildlife, their habitats and threats they face. What if that competition wasn't about who got the most votes, but which bird was the best in a variety of challenges and scenarios?

Bird of the Year is a 9 card game that puts various New Zealand birds against each other to win the prestigious title of 'Bird of the Year'. Can your bird win and be crowned the champion for this year?

—description from the designer

Name: B17: The Fight for Air Supremacy
Description: B17 The Fight for Air Supremacy is a solitaire roll and write war game. The player takes control of a B17 bomber and its crew, the B17 must reach its target and get back home without taking too much damage and trying to keep the crew intact. The player will face many challenges in the form of German fighters, flak and mechanical problems. Can you keep your nerve and take to the skies and help to reduce German fighter production.

Name: Match Ball: The Game After the Match
Description:
Card game simulating the exciting back and forth of a tennis match. Scoring is similar to real tennis, complete with aces and smashes.

Game play requires strategic timing of countering your opponent’s cards. Each card has a level of hierarchy, and choosing the right moment to play or keep each card in your hand presents a new challenge every turn.

First player to win best of three sets (like in the physical sport of tennis), wins the game and receives a trophy card for each set won.

Great family game for any tennis player or fan of the sport. It helps to know actual tennis scoring before starting a game, but can be picked up easily by anyone after a few tries - and can even help teach the sport itself.

Name: Astralis
Description:
Astralis is an abstract, space odyssey, area-control strategy game for two players, played on a hex-hex 8 gameboard. Each player starts with one colony ship pawn and 30 planets stones. Players share 169 double-sided control tiles and 60 contested tiles.

On a turn, a player must move his or her ship pawn one or more hexes, in any one of the six standard directions, to any hex not containing any stone or the opponent's pawn. Pawns may pass over any hexes not containing an opponent's stone or pawn. Pawns can pass over owned stones. Control tiles never impede movement and simply indicate ownership of a hex.

When a pawn reaches its destination hex, the player may place a control tile and an owned stone on top in any one of the empty hexes adjacent to the pawn that is not adjacent to any other stone.

For each hex adjacent to a placed stone, if the hex is not adjacent to any opponent stone, place a control tile own-side up in the hex; and if the hex has one or more adjacent opponent stones, replace the opponent’s control tile with a contested tile.

The game ends when all hexes contain a control or contested tile. To determine the winner, players count the number of control tiles they have on the board. The second player adds a komi of 3.5 points to his total. The player with the highest total wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Circus
Description:
Circus is a board game, a family filler in which you will have to find out the secret combination of circus characters. To do this you will have the help of a blackboard where you can write down everything that happens during the game.

At the beginning of the game and randomly 5 character tokens will be placed face down on the board. Taking turns, all the people will roll the die, the number they get will be the number of tokens they will be able to flip over. That will be the first information they will have. The rest they will have to find out during the course of the game.

To facilitate the work there are the character cards that have their own abilities.

     Track boss: you can move a card from the playing area to the discard deck.
     Clown: you can swap the position of two character cards on the board.
     Bullet woman: everyone must quickly put his hand on this card, the last one to do so must uncover a card from his playing area.
     Trapeze artist: swap a card from your hand with a card from an opponent's hand.
     Juggler: choose who must lose the next turn.
     Magician: secretly uncover as many character cards on the board as the result of the die.
     Audience: use this card to defend yourself from the effects of the trapeze artist, juggler, or ringmaster.


To win, you must not only find out the combination of characters on the board, but you must also have in your playing area the combination formed by the cards that you have had to keep during the game.

The following actions are available each turn:

     Draw a card from the central deck and raise it to your hand.
     Use a card from your hand and execute one of these actions:
         Lower it face down to your playing area
         Turn the card
    


The winner is the one who manages to find out the combination of characters on the board and has the generated combination in his playing area. To end the game, the person who thinks he has the winning combination must play a Carp card.

Name: 1562: The Beginning of a Tragedy
Description:
1562 : beginning of a tragedy is a grand tactical game which, for the first time, allows the simulation of three battles of that era:

     DREUX, 19th December 1562 : the very first important battle.
     VERGT (VER as known at this era), 9th October 1562 : won by the very famous catholic general Blaise de Montluc.
     LE BESSAT, 31st October 1562 ; an intro scenario with few counters for discovering the rules.


1562 : the beginning of a tragedy is the Volume III of the series By Shot, Shock and Faith (in French: "Par le feu, le fer et la foi") allows the simulation of religious wars that occurred in France from 1562 to 1598. This civil war opposes, in a first conflict phase, protestants- otherwise known as Huguenots- to catholics, then royalists to League members after the accession of Henri IV to the throne in 1589. The art of war during this period of the Renaissance is rapidly changing. The great feudal landlords, steeped in morals, fight alongside mercenaries motivated by sole cupidity. The diversity of the weapons that are used offers great tactical possibilities, based on impact and fire. Gendarmes, cuirassiers, reiters, harquebusiers, lansquenets and Swiss mercenaries confront each other in a merciless fight.

This is a classic game system ; « I go, You go », of average complexity, including, during the active player's phase, a sequence of reaction from the passive player, such as fire, counter-charge or tactical backstep. The maps are with areas from 300 to 500 m by side. A color code allows to easily determine the costs of movements and the line of sight. The scale of the game is one unit for 100 to 500 soldiers or one or two guns. One game turn represents a duration of 20 to 30 minutes. A corps represents either a vanguard or a rearguard, or the main body called battle.

The combats allow to simulate charges « en haie » (in hedge), the merciless shocks between pikemen, the artillery fire and highlight, by a support system, the combination of iron -shock- and fire -shooting. The optional rules- caracoles, orders, lost children, looting- add even more realism to the era's battles. The rules and the three battles offered are based on a thorough bibliography and researches made into books written by contemporary authors, specifically François de la Noue for the Protestants and Blaise de Montluc for the Catholics, and also on precise topographical plans of each battlefield that is still accessible... Are you ready to put on the boots of Henri de Guise or the Prince de Condé and fight your enemies ?

—description from the designer
Families: Series: By Shot, Shock and Faith (Hexasim)

Name: Battle Shards
Description:
Be the player with the most Shards (cards) in your Shard Pile (cards you won) to win! To win Shards, have the highest attack.

Your attack depends on the color of your solid block (red, yellow or blue), against the number that matches your opponent's square for that color (1, 2 or 3).

—description from the designer

Name: État d'urgence
Description:
Un homme tousse à Wuhan, une femme a de la fièvre à Londres, un voyageur arrive à Paris : c’est parti pour une épidémie mondiale ! Seul problème : vous n’avez aucune compétence et votre système de santé est digne du Moyen Âge… Incarnez le gouvernement, le conseil scientifique, les laboratoires, les complotistes ou les médias et faites les bons choix pour conserver la confiance du peuple et faire fondre celle de vos adversaires.
Tri des patients à l’hôpital ou applaudissements aux fenêtres ? Un documentaire complotiste ou l’avis d’Éric Zemmour ? Quelle carte jouer pour vous aider ? Dans ce deckbuilding d’affrontement aux règles simples et efficaces, vous tenterez de dénouer les fils compliqués d’un virus planétaire. Essayez d’être le dernier à qui les Français accordent encore un peu de confiance !
Un jeu de cartes stratégique qui retrace un an et demi d’épidémie sous la plume de Jérémy Ferrari.

Name: Surviving Singapore
Description:
Life in Singapore is full of obstacles. Can you survive?

Surviving Singapore is a strategy card game where players attempt to overcome obstacles, and be the first to reach the level 8 to win the game. From running out of toilet paper, losing your IC, to being in the same room as a cockroach that can fly.


     Overcome obstacles: Face obstacles and beat them to gain a level
     Sabo your friends: Slow down the competition and hinder their progress
     Reach the top: Be the first to climb your way up to level 8


Can you survive all the obstacles that SG can throw at you?

Name: Game of United States History
Description:
Game of United States History is designed for play by 3-10 persons.  It contains 56 cards in which seven historical divisions are included: 

      Commerce and Industry
      Education and Religion
      Finance
      Invention
      Territorial Expansion
      Transportation
      War


Each of these divisions treats two or more subjects/events/movements, with two cards giving specifics regarding the subject/event/movement.  Of the two cards, the first treats the beginning or early phase of the movement; the second details the results of the event or the evolution of the movement.  The two cards constitute a "pair".  In matching the cards of a pair, the same illustrations occur on each card of the pair.

The instructions include directions for five different variations that may be played with this game.

—user summary

Name: Rise TCG
Description:
Rise is a unique trading card game set in a fantasy multiverse infused with powers and magic.

Rise is a card game based on deck construction, strategy, inertia and luck. 
You can play it alone (dungeon mode) or in duel, and especially in multiplayer.
 Evolve your summoners and unleash your power to be the only player to have at least 1 of his summoners still alive.

The first season contains 306 different carefully designed and illustrated cards.

Rise is much more than these few lines, to really know and discover the game, with its possibilities, its gameplay and its depth, I invite you to discover all the informations on the wiki page of the project: rules of the game, the complete list of cards, the history and much more!

Name: Audimat
Description:
Choose one of four location (yacht, loft, villa, deserted island).
Each player chooses one of eight clothing and accessory card.

The show is about to start.
You play as TV show contestants, in a Big Brother style show:
The Production manages everything, you can't leave the set and cameras are rolling day and night.

Read the few rule cards: Big Brother is setting up the boundaries.
Then take turn reading and answering question cards. This is Big Brother summoning you in isolation to answer private questions.
The story will grow, one card, one answer at a time. Before you know it, an exciting story will unfold, filled with plots, backstories, partnership and betrayals.

You'll need to vote your rivals out but beware: the eliminated contestants still participate in votes (representing the viewers' vote).
Can you be the last one standing?

Name: iGranie z Gruzem: Nędzność i Biedność
Description:
Just when you think that life can't get any worse, it always surprises you with something terrible. The same with iGaming with Rubble! You thought it couldn't get any worse? Yes, it can!

NÄ™dznoÅ›Ä‡ i BiednoÅ›Ä‡ ("Misery and Poverty") is an unbelievable addition to the game. 55 new cards will make your character's life even more miserable, every trip to work an ordeal, and breathing a sigh of relief at the thought of chilling - a challenge to fate.

description from the publisher (translated)

Kiedy myÅ›lisz, Å¼e w Å¼yciu nie moÅ¼e spotkaÄ‡ CiÄ™ juÅ¼ nic gorszego, ono zawsze zaskakuje czymÅ› okropnym. Podobnie w iGraniu z Gruzem! WydawaÅ‚o Wam siÄ™, Å¼e gorzej juÅ¼ byÄ‡ nie moÅ¼e? MoÅ¼e!

iGranie z Gruzem: NÄ™dznoÅ›Ä‡ i BiednoÅ›Ä‡ to niesamodzielny dodatek do gry. 55 nowych kart sprawi, Å¼e Å¼ycie postaci bÄ™dzie jeszcze wiÄ™kszÄ… mÄ™czarniÄ…, kaÅ¼de wyjÅ›cie do pracy stanie siÄ™ drogÄ… przez mÄ™kÄ™, a odetchniÄ™cie z ulgÄ… na myÅ›l o chilloucie - rzuceniem wyzwania losowi.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chess Mage
Description:
Chess Mage is a chess extension using a deck building mechanism to allow new moves and make chess more challenging.

Each player has a base deck and can get additional cards paying them with pieces they capture.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Tome of Champions 2021
Description:
The Tome of Champions 2021 is an essential companion to Warcry, no matter how you like to play. From new narrative content to twists for matched play and fresh open play game modes, it’s packed with updated rules and ideas to inspire you. Incredible new adventures in the Eightpoints await.

Inside, you'll find:

     A Rules Update for 2021, including the introduction of Grand Alliances in Warcry
     Updated points values for Warcry fighter cards to better reflect their power in battle
     Open play rules for fighting sieges between two teams of players
     Narrative play rules for branching quests where players get to choose their path through the adventure
     New fated quests for warbands from each of the four Grand Alliances
     Six narrative campaigns that offer a new dynamic challenge to players
     Pitched battles battleplans for the new Warcry season and a detailed tournament pack, making running your own even easier than ever before
     New hidden agendas that can be used as secondary objectives in tournaments
     Rules for using the Lumineth Realm-lords, Soulblight Gravelords, Kruleboyz orruks, and Thunderstrike Stormcast Eternals in Warcry
     Rules for using Warhammer Underworlds warbands from Shadespire, Nightvault, Beastgrave, and Direchasm in your games of Warcry


—description from the publisher

Name: Star Flix
Description:
Star Flix is a fast paced, dexterity based space combat game for 2 or more players. In an all-action battle of strategy & skill, you will need to outwit and out-flick your opponents to achieve total orbital dominance!

Slick, intuitive game play, multiple game modes & variants combined with components of the highest possible standard, make this the perfect space combat game for both hardened wargamers & casual players alike.

Gameplay
Players alternately flick their units until every unit has moved, the shooting phase then takes place simultaneously at the end of the round. Every unit has one or more energy cubes which they can allocate to shields, weapons, repair etc. The allocation of the cube will then dictate how much damage is inflicted or mitigated during the shooting phase.

There are several modes of play but predominantly the aim of the game is to destroy the opposing team's units.

—description from the designer

Name: Torus
Description:
An abstract game played on a 2D board in a 3D area control environment. Originally designed as a teaching tool for advanced mathematical applications in biology. Now a challenging mobile strategy game for 2 or play in solo mode; your intuitive versus your analytical mind.

The goal is to surround your opponent's play pieces and flip them to your color through strategic placement and movement on a toroidal shape, represented by the 100 square flat game board.

—description from the publisher

Name: Der Siegeslauf des Hakenkreuzes: Deutsches Gesellschaftsspiel
Description:
Third Reich period time board game "Der Siegeslauf des Hakenkreuzes - Deutsches Gesellschaftsspiel" (eng. "The victory run of the swastika - German parlor game").
It is typical roll and move game. The first player, who cross the route with 120 stops first, wins the game.

The board game was approved by the political police in Bavaria in the spring of 1933, and according to historian André Postert it was a bestseller. However, since the game also addresses the failures of the party, a ban procedure was opened as part of the "anti-kitsch law".

Name: Pop Under Pressure
Description:
Think fast before the blast...  But don't let the pressure get to you!

Players try to come up with a word in each of twelve categories with the first letter chosen by a spinner.  While doing so a balloon is slowly inflating as a timer.  When the balloon pops, players compare words and score a point for each valid word that none of the other players came up with.

Name: Worst Enemy
Description:
Worst Enemy is a (mostly) cooperative trick-taking card game with rotating hidden roles and one-vs-all mechanisms. It's designed for 2 to 4 players ages 12 and up, and lasts between 30 - 40 minutes.

The premise is that you all play as parts of a single mind, however, each round one of you will take the part of the Core Personality who shoulders the sole responsibility of scoring for the group. The other players take on the roles of negative personality traits each playing with a unique rule that confounds how the tricks play.

The game is a race against your bad tendencies as each round you lose advances a Worst Enemy token closer to the end of the score track. Can you work together to score enough tricks to reach the end, or will you prove that old adage once again, "Sometimes you are your own worst enemy"?

Name: Pocket Sports Snooker
Description:
Pocket Sports Snooker replicates the tension and thrill of the game with a great simulation.

The game uses five custom dice that cover safety play, potting chances, tricky pots, snookers and colours you can attempt after potting a red. You have been left a tricky chance, do you go for the pot or play it safe? Keep the break going or wait for another opportunity to clear up?

Pocket Snooker needs strategy but not a table so you can play it anywhere. All you need is the dice.

Name: DKR Rally Raid
Description:
Welcome to DKR Rally Raid, considered one of the toughest and most famous rallies in the world. Try to finish each stage in the shortest time possible, carefully following the roadbook. Overcome the inconveniences that arise, taking care of the car from the difficulties of the terrain and enduring the unfavorable weather to win this difficult competition. Let's race!

The objective is to finish 6 stages obtaining the lowest overall time. Each stage consists of going with your car from point A: start; to point B: finish line. In each game turn you must roll 2 dice, assign one for your direction and one for your speed, and find out their meaning in the roadbook to move the car according to your choice. In each stage, the terrain and the weather will make your life difficult. At the end of some stages you can repair damage to the vehicle, but sometimes you will have to repair damage in the middle of the race. At the end of the sixth and last stage, the winner will be the one who gets the lowest overall time.

—description from the designer

Name: Pocket Sports Darts
Description:
Pocket Darts replicates a typical game of darts. Using seven custom dice, you roll to reduce your score down from 501 to zero, but you must end on a double.

Throw the dice, score 180 or maybe you got a bad lie. Work your way down to a double but try and get to one of the favourite doubles to give you more chance of checking out. How to finish from a particular total? Don't worry about that, there is a handy checkout guide to help you out.

Name: Empatiza2
Description:
It all starts with EMPATHY, which is the ability to perceive, share and understand what another may feel. In Empatiza2, the sequel to Empatizate, we are going to talk about gender parity, emotions, self-esteem, anxiety and stress, money management, commitment to the environment, among others. We will learn to say YES, NO and I DON'T KNOW. This game allows us to anticipate and solve interpersonal conflicts and achieve a greater emotional connection with people. When you say "Empathize", it is to put yourself in the place, defending the cause, for 1 minute in both cases in a mandatory way.

The “YES”, “NO” and “DON'T KNOW” are placed in the center of the table and 5 cards are dealt to each player.

Each player reads his cards and strategically chooses one to pass to the player on his right saying "empathize". This action must be done by everyone at the same time. The youngest begins to answer and from there to the right of him one by one during 1 round. If you meet the slogan, score points, if not. The answered letters are left on one side.

The game ends when all the cards in hand are answered. Cards are scored at the top. Whoever scores the most points wins.

Name: The Dark Forest
Description:
Scientists on your homeworld have discovered that the true nature of the universe is not unlike a Dark Forest, with solar systems connected by branches of a Cosmic Tree. Your people have started to travel to nearby stars, but even so, you have not found other advanced life. Obsessed with the search for your cosmic brothers and sisters, you set out exploring from your homeworld. To aid in exploration, your scientists have invented The Singularity Probe, a machine that can travel into space and speed up time, turning the millennia it would take to travel to the stars into hours. As a side effect of time speeding up however, life on nearby planets grows in leaps and bounds every time the Probe causes one of these leaps in time. Oversee and guide the development of life in the Universe, and discover whether we are alone in the Dark Forest.

In this action selection game, players will use Seekers to Sow the seeds of life on planets, Settle their own Watchers on a planet, and plan jumps to new solar systems that will occur during the next Leap in time. Watchers then will work to Suppress or Elevate the native life on a planet, tending them for a later Reaping, or perhaps helping them evolve to higher forms of life. Each new planet you discover will have unique properties, yielding a new worker placement spot that will alter the possible strategies in the game. The winner of the game is the first to find and make peace with an Ancient Civilization, if one exists, or to become the only advanced species in the universe if not.

Name: Monsters & Minecarts
Description:
Have you ever been out on a picnic when a sinkhole opens up and drops you into a scary old mine filled with strange and dangerous creatures?

Well, let me tell you what to do if you're ever in that situation!
You gather up all the picnic supplies you can find, leap into a minecart to try your best to escape from the monsters, avoid the cave-ins, and keep your distance from the mad scientist who's just as likely to help you as he is to turn you into one of his experiments.

The objective of the game is to place enough track cards in a row to escape the mine. The number of tracks you'll need will vary depending on the number of players but the gameplay remains the same. The monsters, the natural disasters and the mad scientist will all be working against you.

—description from the designer

Name: Diabolik: La lama della vendetta
Description:
Diabolik Storie - La Lama della Vendetta (The Blade of Vengeance) is a collaborative crime-themed game, in which it is possible to impersonate the well-known comic book character and his partner Eva Kant. Players must work together to complete a heist, interactively reliving the story of the comic book of the same name released in April 2018.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Diabolik Storie – La Lama della Vendetta è un gioco collaborativo a tema crime, in cui è possibile impersonare il noto personaggio dei fumetti e la sua compagna Eva Kant. I giocatori devono collaborare per portare a termine un colpo, rivivendo in modo interattivo la storia dell’omonimo albo a fumetti uscito nell’aprile del 2018, il cui straordinario successo ha dato origine a un sequel. Come? Usando i noti gadget del Re del Terrore come maschere, pugnali e la sua inconfondibile Jaguar, interagendo con i personaggi della storia e stando attenti a evitare la polizia guidata dal commissario Ginko.

Ma Diabolik Storie non è solo un gioco di carte a se stante, ma può essere infatti utilizzato per espandere e approfondire l’esperienza del gioco da tavolo Diabolik Colpi e Crimini, diventando un’espansione a tutti gli effetti.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Guild of Merchant Explorers: The Queen's Special Orders
Description:
The Queen has sent out a call to The Guild of Merchant Explorers, asking brave adventurers to voyage to all corners of the kingdom of Tigomé. While the kingdom is flourishing, its maps have not been updated in some time and its great cities have lost contact with one another. With your team of explorers, you will journey over rough seas, majestic mountains, vast deserts, and lush grasslands to establish trade routes between cities, visit far-seeing discovery towers, and discover new villages that have emerged.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Gusk Knife Promo Cards
Description:
Gusk Knives Grimmory is packaged in a box that includes:

1 x Gusk Knives - Grimmory hard plastic miniature
1 x Hard plastic Grimmory miniature
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base and scenic insert
1 x Impacted Gusk indomitable Gorm resource
1 x Gusk Knife pattern
2 x Gusk knife pattern gear
1 x Install guide
1 x Large matte art print

The monster's malformed maw drooped at one swollen side, spraying with pus as the monster swayed and lumbered. Even though it sensed its own failing life, the Gorm lunged with its fangs at the remaining survivor. With a final exhausted thrust into the monster's mouth, Grimmory landed a blow on the massive, angry cyst pulsing in the monster's jaw. An unimaginably loud howl of pain tore his eardrums to shreds.

The indomitable monsters that stalk the darkness unchallenged tend to grow features not normally found in younger specimens of the species. Survivors brave and lucky enough to survive encounters with these monsters gain indomitable resources. These unusual components inspire new configurations of gear worthy of these hard won treasures.

Name: Pangaex
Description:
Pangaex is a world-conquering game with aspects of Risk, Catan, and Terraforming Mars. The game is played on a modular board (81 2"-square tiles), each of which indicates one of the following resources: Culture, Food, Weapons, Commerce, Mountains, or Lakes. Each player starts with a Capital game piece and two village game pieces, which are placed in a snake-draft system. Each player also begins with some resources and a soldier, who begins the game on the Capital tile.

The game is played in two repeating phases: Production phase (collecting resources based on villages and/or soldiers in play), and Action phase. The Production phase happens simultaneously, where all players collect resources at the same time. The Action phase is where the bulk of the game is played. Players can move their soldiers; they can also use resources to build villages, train soldiers, and even convert enemy villages to their own culture. Like Terraforming Mars, each player may take up to two actions on their turn--however, a pass is not a pass for the whole Action phase, but merely a pass on a given turn. The Action phase ends when all players have passed consecutively.

Soldiers are more than just soldiers in Pangaex. Soldiers raze enemy villages, but they also help to rebuild their own villages. They prevent peaceful cultural conversion, and they even collect resources at times.

When any player plays their final village, the game ends after the Action phase concludes (i.e. final village signifies final round, not final play). Points are awarded for villages on the board, enemy villages that you've collected (by razing or converting), and other metrics to balance out the game.

—description from the designer

Name: The Carniverse: Tales of Survival Vol. 1
Description:
Welcome to the very first Tales of Survival supplement for the Carniverse. Inside you'll find many different elements to change up the standard method of play, and to add tons of content to your games all for the price of a couple cups of coffee!

In this first volume you will find the following additions to the core rule book.

1 new Leader
3 new Character types
2 new Ranged weapons
1 new Melee weapon
5 new Gear items

New Base expansion rules
2 new Base Facilities
2 new Dinosaur species
4 new Scenarios

New random Weather based rules
New Time of Day rules
New Special Cache rules
New rules for Injured Dinosaurs
New Solo Play rules

Name: Schätz die Welt: Wer wird Tipp-Weltmeister?
Description:
This geography game runs for 6 rounds: Each round, everyone receives 3 country cards, flag side up. Then 3 category cards are placed in the center of the table.

Now players have to assess their own countries according to the categories and place the country cards accordingly. As soon as all the country cards have been placed, it's time for the evaluation: The player's own game piece may advance according to the score on the game board. When the three categories have been scored, a question about the capital follows.

Name: Echec aux chevaliers
Description:
Échec aux Chevaliers is the tranposition into a board game of the fights that took place in the Middle Ages between the Knights and the men-at-arms.

We play with two players, even if it is possible to play with four. The object of the game is to successfully capture the opponent's citadel and stay there for an entire turn without being captured.

Échec aux Chevaliers is a fairly rare game. It is indeed sought after by both board game enthusiasts and collectors of Mokarex figurines.

Name: おそうじとねこ (Osouji to Neko)
Description:
ãŠãã†ã˜ã¨ã­ã“ (Osouji to Neko) is a shedding game from Japan. Players are trying to clean up the cat's pawprints across the house. But the cat keeps being naughty.

Players are dealt a hand of cards, numbered from 1 to 12 in six colours. There are also some special action cards, including a joker. The start player (who most recently cleaned) lays out a card and players must play a card or combos that are better, or pass. Once everyone has passed, the last player to play leads the next round.

Cards must be played out in the style of [thing15878], in sets and runs, which can include the jokers. So a pair of 4s can be raised by a pair of 5s, or by three 8s. But three 3s won't do, nor a run of any kind. Likewise, if a run is lead, it can be raised by better runs, but not by sets.

As cards are played out, the cat marker is moved down, and when it hits zero, the players hands are scored. The player with the most points is covered in pawprints, and the fewest points wins.

The publisher says the game is easy enough for young players to enjoy.
user summary

Name: Sigil
Description:
Sigil is a two player, abstract board game, along the lines of Mancala.

In it, both players move the same pieces around the board in an attempt to leave their opponent unable to take a turn.

—description from the designer

Name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Crisis
Description:
In Terraforming Mars Ares Expedition: Crisis, players will play as corporations, just as in the original Ares Expedition. You choose phases and play project cards as normal. The difference is players are working together to keep Mars habitable after a natural disaster has landed the planet in crisis. Every round, a new Crisis card will be drawn that will require the players to achieve a certain goal to remove that crisis from play. Each turn that a Crisis card is not completely dealt with, it will lower one or more of the terraforming metrics that keep Mars habitable.

Handle all the crises as they arise. Eventually, a Crisis card will be drawn that allows the players to win the game once they have completed re-terraforming Mars.
Families: Versions & Editions: Card Versions of Non-Card Games

Name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Discovery
Description:
Terraforming Mars Ares Expedition: Discovery adds four new mechanics to base Ares Expedition: awards, milestones, upgraded phase cards, and wild tags.

Awards are end-of-game scoring that are granted to the player with the most of something. Three awards are drawn at the beginning of the game so that players know what they will be rewarded for at the end of the game. The player with the most of that item earns 5VP, second place earns 2VP.

Milestones are VP that are awarded during the game. They are granted to the player to first achieve the milestone. Milestones are worth 3 VP at the end of the game.

Some new project and corporation cards allow players to upgrade their phase cards. Each phase card has two different version that players choose from when they upgrade them. The upgrade gives the player a better bonus when they choose that phase.

Some new project cards have a wild tag. Whenever a player reveals this card either from the deck (due to an effect) or from their hand because they are going to play it, that player chooses what tag they want it to be. Tokens are used to keep track of what tag was chosen for the rest of the game.
Families: Versions & Editions: Card Versions of Non-Card Games

Name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Foundations
Description:
Ares Expedition: Foundations contains additional player boards, cubes, and phase cards so that Ares Expedition can be played with up to six players. This expansion also includes two additional game boards. One is a larger score track. The other adds a fourth terraforming metric: infrastructure.

Additionally, there are new project cards that involve the new terraforming metric and a new phase card.
Families: Versions & Editions: Card Versions of Non-Card Games

Name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Discovery · Foundations · Crisis
Description:
In, Terraforming Mars Ares Expedition: Crisis, players will play as corporations, just as in the original Ares Expedition. You choose phases and play project cards as normal. The difference is players are working together to keep Mars habitable after a natural disaster has landed the planet in crisis. Every round, a new Crisis card will be drawn that will require the players to achieve a certain goal to remove that crisis from play. Each turn that a Crisis card is not completely dealt with, it will lower one or more of the terraforming metrics that keep Mars habitable.

Handle all the crises as they arise. Eventually, a Crisis card will be drawn that allows the players to win the game once they have completed re-terraforming Mars.

Terraforming Mars Ares Expedition: Discovery adds four new mechanics to base Ares Expedition: awards, milestones, upgraded phase cards, and wild tags.

Awards are end of game scoring that are granted to the player with the most of something. Three awards are drawn at the beginning of the game so that players know what they will be rewarded for at the end of the game. The player with the most of that item earns 5VP, second place earns 2VP.

Milestones are VP that are awarded during the game. They are granted to the player to first achieve the milestone. Milestones are worth 3 VP at the end of the game.

Some new project and corporation cards allow players to upgrade their phase cards. Each phase card has two different version that players choose from when they upgrade them. The upgrade gives the player a better bonus when they choose that phase.
Some new project cards have a wild tag. Whenever a player reveals this card either from the deck (due to an effect) or from their hand because they are going to play it, that player chooses what tag they want it to be. Tokens are used to keep track of what tag was chosen for the rest of the game.

Ares Expedition: Foundations contains additional player boards, cubes, and phase cards so that Ares Expedition can be played with up to six players. This expansion also includes two additional game boards. One is a larger score track. The other adds a fourth terraforming metric: infrastructure.
Additionally, there are new project cards that involve the new terraforming metric and a new phase card.
Families: Versions & Editions: Card Versions of Non-Card Games

Name: Warpgate: Beyond
Description:
New Expansion for Warpgate, a fast-paced game of galactic conquest. Includes new and reworked Objectives, new Tactics, Technologies, a separate deck for Solo AI, and more!

Warpgate: Beyond replaces all cards in the base game, and adds new ones, bringing the total to 242 cards (not counting the "Daily Unlocks").

Hero, Basic and Advanced Tactics cards were rebalanced and many new ones were added.
All Technology cards were reworked and rebalanced. 
Two Solo-AI action decks are included in the expansion, enhancing the solo experience. 
Objective cards now have partial completion mechanism, existing Objectives were reworked or rebalanced and new ones were added.

A copy of the base game is required to play this expansion.

Name: Edgeguard
Description:
By our calendar, the third day of the month of storms was when our world changed forever. Each of the leaders of the five great nations were assassinated by an unknown force, leaving the councils and elders fumbling to reply to this unknown threat. Many laid blame at the feet of ancestral hatreds. The Dwarves blamed the Goblins. The Orcs blamed the Elves. The Humans blamed the Orcs. and the Goblins blamed everyone, as befits their fear and paranoia. What the secretive Elves believe is a thing of mystery...though perhaps you will be the one to uncover the truth?

The Edgeguard is to be a force of elite warriors, rangers, clerics, mages, and rogues—the best of the best. Each nation will contribute forces with a mandate to seek out our mysterious new enemy and report back to their leaders. From these humble beginnings, five heroes will arise, one from each nation, to become our championsâ —the defenders of Ebonmoor.

Edgeguard is a story-driven tabletop miniatures game for 1-4 players drawing mechanical inspiration from classic experiences across both table and screen—featuring highly detailed miniatures, immersive mechanics, and beautiful artwork.

—description from the designer

Name: The Thing with the Ring (Second Edition)
Description:
Robbits (the nickname for Urban Halflings) are a small mischievous folk with an uncanny habit of ‘finding’ ancient relics of vast and horrifying power. In this case, a troublesome Ring, belonging to an evil wizard called Nörmün. Nörmün has sent his Goblins to retrieve the Ring, even as the Wizard Gudgrief tries to form a Party of Dwarves, Elves and Robbits to take the Ring away on a Quest.

But the reluctant Robbits know that nobody ever comes back from Gudgrief’s Quests, so the Dwarves are forced to Press-Gang and the Elves to Enchant them out of their Pits to join the Party. However, Robbits are innately ‘Tricksy’ and will use Magic and Excuses to avoid going on the Quest. Only one Robbit will live to tell the epic tale of...
The Thing with the Ring!

In The Thing with the Ring, you take on the role of a Robbit and the object of the game is to avoid going on the Quest to get rid of the evil Ring. Dwarves, Elves and Goblins will turn up on your doorstep and you must manage them with Magic and Excuses or risk joining the Party and going on the Quest.

The Game is for one to six Players and it is comprised of one Rulebook, one hundred cards, and one die, known as the Battle Die.

—description from the publisher

Name: Polyhedral Potions
Description:
Polyhedral Potions is a roll & write dice drafting game using a set of 7 polyhedral dice for 2-5 players, with a solo variant. Players will use the dice (Ingredients) to craft different types of Potions and Poisons in order to earn Stars and points for making Distillations and Fulminates.

On your turn you’ll complete three steps:

1. Draft Ingredients and mark them on the Ingredients chart on your score sheet.
2. Combine the Ingredients to Craft a Potion and mark that on the Potion chart 
3. Use the Potion (or Poison).

The game ends when someone earns their third Star. Finish the round. The person to the right of the first player will take the last turn. Then proceed to scoring.

Solo Variant
The solo game plays in about 20 minutes and presents a challenge similar to playing a multiplayer game. Challenge yourself to earn the highest rank possible. Will you become a potion Wizard? There are also 19 Potion Brewing Feats you can try to accomplish!

Name: Go Make A  Hike
Description:
Go Make a Hike is a competitive tile drafting and placement game for 2-4 players (with a solo mode) about building the perfect hiking path. Each round, players will draft either a Trail or Destination tile to add to their Trail System. Destinations require certain features along their trail: Water, Flowers, Wildlife, or Viewpoints.

As players work to build the perfect hike their trails will grow and spread across the table in an impressive display of nature's beauty!

Solo mode included.

Name: Polyhedral Perils
Description:
In Polyhedral Perils you and any other number of players are heroes whose hobby is exploring dungeons, battling the monsters who dwell there, and bragging about your exploits. But who is the greatest hero? You decide to hold a competition to determine, once and for all, who the hero with the greatest prestige is.

All you need to play Polyhedral Perils is a set of seven polyhedral dice (D4, D6, D8, D10, D%, D12, and D20), something to keep score, and some competitors (or play solo - see below).

Taking turns, each hero will attempt to defeat the strongest monster they can. As monsters are defeated you'll earn Prestige. Head back to the village to brag about your exploits at any time to secure your Prestige, but if you are defeated you'll return dejected and forlorn and earn much less Prestige.

Polyhedral Perils Solo In the solo variant, you are trapped deep within the dungeon and must fight your way to escape. There is no Prestige, you are fighting for your life! You must defeat enough monsters to escape the dungeon before you perish.

Polyhedral Perils: The Champion's Journey
The Champion’s Journey is a way to play a campaign mode of Polyhedral Perils. This is a solo adventure that can be played in one or several sessions and will take about 30-40 minutes to complete. You’ll track your progress across multiple games with additional challenges and abilities as you progress through locations on the map of the Kingdom of Petitia. Each location must be defeated before you can move to the next location. Each location will have a new challenge that must be overcome, but doing so will give you a benefit that you can use in future challenges.

Name: Polyhedral Predicaments: Dungeon Demise
Description:
In Polyhedral Predicaments - Dungeon Demise you are a hero delving deep into a dungeon in search of treasures. You'll encounter a maze of rooms, each with a powerful enemy, weapons and tools that will help you on your journey, as well as coins and gems. Collect what you can, survive if you are able, and defeat the dungeon boss at the end to earn a trove of valuables!

Polyhedral Predicaments is a series within a series! These are small, 18-card games that share similar mechanics as you go on adventures and survive disasters.

Name: Invasion: The Conquest of Kings
Description:
Invasion is a military strategy game where players manage resources, expand their kingdoms, forge alliances, and wage war against their enemies.

The map is constructed by the players by placing land tiles. This means the map is different in every game of Invasion! By placing castles on the land tiles, players collect different resources, which will allow them to build roads and castles, buy soldiers, and purchase advantage cards.

A player’s king is their most valuable piece in the game. A king’s army is more powerful, can move quicker, and can siege an enemy castle more easily. A king can only be killed when all soldiers in their army are dead, so players need to be strategic about how many soldiers they put in their king’s army, and how they weaken their enemies’ armies.

Killing an enemy king gives that player a king’s crown token, and the first player to gain two king’s crown tokens wins the game. Players of Invasion will need to juggle using their king’s offensive capabilities, with protecting them from their enemies. Players will siege castles, block their enemies’ movement, kill their soldiers, and battle their king’s army in an all out war to decide who is the most powerful kingdom in the land.

—description from the publisher

Name: Caught in the Act
Description:
Hanki-Panki is going on. Sex is a natural part of life. But the question is Who? is doing What? to Whom? and Where?

This game is your chance to be an investigative reporter and uncover the naked truth. If you are the first plater to correctly catch a couple in the act - YOU WIN!!!

On your turn, roll the dice to determine how many spaces you can move. When you reach a room, ask another player to reveal one fact they know. Keep your notes and try to narrow down who did what, to whom, and where.
Families: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

Name: My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria Deck-Building Game – Familiar Faces Expansion
Description: My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria Deck-Building Game – Familiar Faces Expansion adds more cards to My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria Deck-Building Game.

Name: Three Sisters: Rock Garden Expansion
Description:
The Three Sisters Rock Garden expansion is an additional scorepad that can be used with Three Sisters. The gameplay is simple, each time you draft a die in Three Sisters, you cross off one space matching the die value and whenever you complete a row or column with crossed off spaces,  you choose an adjacent bonus that is used on your main sheets. The Rock Garden is a 3"x5" score pad with 50 double-sided pages.

This was available as an add-on during the Motor City Kickstarter campaign.
Families: Series: Loaded Roll and Write (Motor City Gameworks)

Name: Battle of Brandywine
Description:
The Battle of Brandywine is a two player Tactical level wargame about the American Revolutionary War battle, designed to be a low complexity game but also offers enough optional rules to give the game more complexity for the die-hard wargamer.

The game sets up quickly with both sides commanding roughly 30 units each and several leaders per side, you can set up the game and finish the battle in under two hours.

The unique aspect of the game is the turn sequence and the ability to resolve combat without a combat results chart.  All combat is resolved by rolling a D6 per unit.  Units that move first receive fire first.

The game includes several scenarios and optional rules and advanced rules.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Tome: The Gold Codex
Description: Upgrade your Tome collection with 3 new Elements. Includes 6 Basic Wood spells, 6 Basic Insect spells, and 6 Special Gold Spells.

Name: SuperMark Bygger Hus
Description:
A card game for children and others, 5 years and up. You're trying to build a play house by drawing cards from the other players, but avoiding the "Ouch, my finger!" cards.

On your turn, you choose to either

a) draw a building card from another player's hand into your own hand. If you draw an "Ouch, my finger!" card, you discard that and your entire hand of building cards to the bottom of the draw pile.

b) play a subgame where you place one of your tool cards face down and say "Tool". All other players will now also place one of their tool cards face down, and then everybody reveals their chosen tool. The active player will draw a building card from the draw pile, if at least one other player has chosen a different tool. Each of the other players will draw a card, if they chose the same tool as the active player.

At the end of your turn you win by having all four different building cards in your hand. Otherwise play passes to the next player.

Name: 4-in-1 Dice Games
Description:
4 dice games in 1 box. 
- Play & Repeat
The aim of the game is to earn as much possible money. Money can be earned in 3 different ways: crossing out rows, crossing out colours and crossing out bonus coins.

- Quick & Tactic
You have 3 options during your turn after Rolling the dice: cross out 2 white dice, cross out a combination of 1 white die and 1 coloured dice or pass. The game ends of one player has closed 2 coloured columns.

- Bingo Dice Game
Roll all dice and select 2 of them to cross out on your scoresheet. This game is a little bit like Clever.

- Rainbow Dice Game
Game is like Yatzy, but with coloured dice. The numbers on all dice need to be noted by the right colour.

Name: Go Make A Hike: Off the Beaten Path
Description:
Go Make A Hike: Off the Beaten Path includes three modules that can be added to the base game in any combination.

- Fire & Ice includes 10 new Destinatons with volcanic and snowy themes.
- Ordeals to Adventures adds immediate and ongoing effects that can change the flow of the game.
- Points of Interest adds new, yellow feature cubes that have unique scoring opportunities.

Requires Go Make A Hike to use this expansion.

Name: もやっと海図 (Moyatto Kaizu)
Description:
ã‚‚ã‚„ã£ã¨æµ·å›³ (Moyatto Kaizu) is an exploration game from Japan. The game title means something like 'hazy sea charts'. Players are building up a nautical chart from memory of their voyages, complete with sea monsters. But they aren't quite sure what goes where, and work together to remember what they saw.

In the game, players place tiles showing land and sea. As they place a tile, they can add player pieces, or a pawn worth 2 pieces. If a tile gets to four pieces, it is confident enough to stay. But if it has fewer than four, then some black balls are added to make it up to four.

When a continent is completed, it is scored. Players with the most pieces/pawns get the most points (counting all the pieces on the island), for having been most confident in their memory of the voyage. The next most gets the points of the majority pieces, and so on down. There are bonus points for places of interest on the land (buried treasure) and for adjacent sea monsters.

But the black balls are collected by the majority scorer, and count as negative at the end of the game, along with any player pieces remaining in hand.

The game ends when ten black balls have been used.

The game is a mix of co-operating, and bluffing to complete island with the most confidence.
user summary

Name: Mandale Fruta
Description:
There is a great demand for fruit bags!
To earn points you have to fill the bags with as much weight as possible.
To achieve this goal you can mix the content and even add some stone.
It is a game where you can be honest or deceive others at the risk of being found out.

Each player has different fruit cards in his hand. These fruits have a weight from 1 to 10, there are also stones that weigh 11.
In the first phase, all players secretly use their fruit cards at the same time to fill the different bags on the table with the greatest possible weight.
In the second phase, using rings, all players can distrust the fruits that other players have placed.
In the third phase, the cards are revealed and it is defined who takes the bag according to what they put.

The bags add points at the end of the game. The more bags of the same type, the more points that player will get.

—description from the publisher

Name: Super Skills
Description:
Super skills is the ultimate skill game for all ages. Players compete in randomly selected challenges from a collection of 120 possible tasks.

Challenges are set as either "complete the task" or either as "beat the opponent".

The first player to complete 10 challenges is the winner.

Name: Ich hab mein Herz im Spiel verloren
Description:
The players start with their pewter figures on the colored spaces in the corners of the game board and take turns to roll a die and move their figures. If a figure has completed a trek clockwise around the game board, it advances to the next inner circle. Some spaces benefit or hinder the players. In a game with two players, the first to reach the heart in the center of the game board is the winner.

If more are playing and one of the two players, who arrive at the heart first, has the heart as a playing figure, the two players are a couple and win the game together. If two other figures are first, the last two are the couple and the winners.

—user summary

Name: Smash Up: 10th Anniversary
Description:
Smash Up celebrates 10 years with an all-new set including new factions, a new way to play, and lots of goodies for fans of the game!

We're announcing the factions over time before the release, and so far we've previewed Skeletons, World Champs, and Mermaids!  We'll update this BGG entry when more are previewed.

The set will also include special items such as a Goblin collector coin (FINALLY you can actually flip a coin with your Goblin faction!), the 10th Anniversary Art Book, the all-new Big Base mode of play, and more!

Yeah we'll update those too when we preview them!

—description from the publisher

Name: Planting Evidence: Card Game
Description:
Planting Evidence is a card game for 2-4 players that pits you against your criminal friends.

Each round, players must choose between planting incriminating evidence on their fellow criminals or using similar evidence to build up their alibis.

Build sets of cards to assemble fingerprints from partials, reconstruct DNA, build a car license plate profile, or submit weapons for review.

Be careful not to trigger the end of the game unless you have the least evidence against you, or you lose!

—description from the publisher

Name: 1980's A Decade of Trivia
Description: 1980's A Decade of Trivia is a far out card game! A fun card game to play at a BBQ, take to the beach, or on game night with friends. You'll enjoy this sweet deck of trivia fit for fans of the rockin' 80's.

Name: Geneva 1955
Description:
It is early July 1955, and Geneva is preparing to host a historical summit. The leaders of the USA, UK, France and USSR – the four most powerful countries in the world - are meeting to foster peace between East and West and to stave off the rapidly growing divide now dubbed The Cold War. Naturally, the summit will be neck-deep in spies, rumours and complex loyalties. But as head of the Swiss security forces, you must descend into this miasma of truth and half-truth, for you have learned there are traitors here, anarchists that would gladly catapult the world into lawless chaos. Can you identify all of the anarchists before they derail the summit and threaten global security?

Each card in the deck represents a person who was actually present at the 1955 Geneva Summit, from Ike Eisenhower, US President, down to Germaine Goutte, French Personal Assistant. A pile of random anarchists is dealt at the start of the game, with the remaining cards acting as informants from which you might extract clues. A cunning series of icons lets you compare the front of an informant with the back side of a hidden anarchist to detect whether they match by suit, value, or as a multiple or factor of the value. By clever hand management and astute use of clues you may deduce the suit and rank of each anarchist. But can you find them all before your clues run out and they act?

—description from the designer

Name: Star Trek: Ascendancy – The Dominion War
Description:
Through their Vorta commanders and Jem'Hadar super soldiers, the Founders rule as Gods, bringing order to the galaxy.  The discovery of the Bajoran Wormhole brought this ancient civilisation onto conflict with the more youthful civilisations of the Alpha Quadrant.

Expansion to the popular Star Trek: Ascendancy game, The Dominion War Variant adds the Dominion as a playable civilisation, the Bajoran Wormhole leading to he Gama Quadrant as a new area to explore and a Dominion war variant that changes the playing field by dividing the civilizations into two rival alliances with players striving to see their Alliance dominate the opposing Alliance.

The expansion contains everything you need to add the Dominion, and another player to your games of Star Trek Ascendancy.  Discover the Gamma Quadrant via the Bajoran-Idran Wormhole Systems, encounter new Exploration Cards, plus more Space Lanes and Resource Nodes!

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Trek: Ascendancy – The Breen Confederacy
Description:
Little is known about the secretive Breen, not their appearance, and not even whether they are a single species, or several.  Intensely territorial, the Breen annihilated the Klingon fleet sent to conquer them, leaving the Klingons no wiser as to who or even what they were facing

Expansion for Star Trek Ascendancy Board Game, including everything you need to add the Breen and another player to your games of Star Trek Ascendancy.

Discover new star systems, encounter new Exploration Cards, plus more Space Lanes and Resource Nodes

"Never turn your back on a Breen"
       - The Romulans

—description from the publisher

Name: Vektek Security Kit Escape Game
Description:
Somewhere in the not too distant future, Chris Ramsay sent a distress beacon from the Hadrian Base Station. This is where YOU come in! Can you help Chris track down and eliminate the A.C.E clones?
 This is a stand-alone escape game that comes complete with the following:

     Mobile/Desktop Digital Experience
     Vektek Security Booklet
     Game Cards
     1 Deck of USPCC playing cards


This is an escape room game produced by youtuber, magician, and puzzler Chris Ramsay.

Name: Squendo
Description:
Squendo is an abstract strategy game for 2-4 players that you can take everywhere in a unique, recycled, handmade bag from Australia.

The aim of the game is to have the highest amount of scoring tiles on the board at the end of the game. Do this by stacking to earn double points, or making a square (Squendo) to score 10 points.

The game shines when a triple stack is formed. This is your opportunity to throw out either one or two of your oppositions tiles and watch them squirm.

From minute five, you will be strategising and once you finish, you will want to play again.

—description from the designer

Name: セブンクォーツ (Seven QuartZ)
Description:
ã‚»ãƒ–ãƒ³ã‚¯ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ„ (Seven QuartZ) is a two player card game from Japan. Players are duelling but with only three cards. The goal is to get gem cards, but not to go bust.

Players take on the role of two magicians fighting to get the gems. In the deck, there are seven magicians to choose from, and 28 skills (from 14 cards). Each player gets a magician card and two skill cards, using this combo to try to win gems valued 0-3 (from 30 gem cards). But if they make a total over 7, they go bust.

The designer styles it as a fast game like blackjack with a lot of replay from 100s of possible combos to try.
user summary

Name: セブンクォーツ_ダイヤモンド (Seven QuartZ Diamond)
DaG Eight Chess (ダグエイトチェス)
Description:
ãƒ€ã‚°ã‚¨ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒã‚§ã‚¹ (DaG Eight Chess) is a two player abstract game from Japan, a mix of Chess and Stratego on a smaller 5*5 chequer board.

Players have a small Chess army that move across the board, but as face-down tokens. The pieces are one each of King, Queen, Rook, Knight and Bishop, and three Pawns. These pieces all move and attack as in normal Chess.

But if a player can deduce which piece is which, they can declare a piece's identity instead of moving. If correct, that piece is eliminated. A player wins by getting the eight army pieces, or by getting the King.
user summary

Name: Soul of Ankiril
Description:
Soul of Ankiril is a Strategic Card Game where players will compete using thematic decks of 25 cards, one of each element or Temen (Fire, Air, Water, Earth, Wood and Metal), with the aim of deactivating the Emanation Portals on the opponent’s field. To do this, players will move their creatures on a board made up of hexagons, then it will be up to them to make the most of the map to achieve victory.

Each player will be able to construct their deck and choose a specific Board that represents their half of the battlefield, once the two players connects their halves the game can start! Both players will then place their Emanation portals and Leaders.

During their turn, players will be be able to:

- Play a card from their hand (Creature or Spell) for 1 Energy Point.
- Move a creature on the board.
- Attack or Activate a Special Ability.
- Draw a Card for 1 Energy Point.

Most of the Creatures will attack and move by the adjacent hexagon but this range can be increased thanks to spells and Special Ability like Throw or Overfly.

First Player that deactivates the 3 Emanation Portals of the opponent wins the game!

Each Creature is unique so during the Deck Construction phase before a match it will be crucial to choose the best combination of Creatures and Spells even of different Temen.

—description from the publisher

Name: Da Mafia (ダマフィア)
Description:
Da Mafia (ãƒ€ãƒžãƒ•ã‚£ã‚¢) is a crime game from Japan, with players concealing their gangster cards to control the city.

The game works as a worker placement game, but the workers are cards for the different gang members; Bosses, Members, Hitman, and Bodyguards. Each player is the head of their gang and places their initial four cards face-down around the city. When they are turned, they might control that section, and gain benefits such as recruiting more gangsters.

But before cards are turned up, players have a chance to guess who is concealed where in the city. If they are correct, the player outsmarts the opponent ands gains an advantage.

Each player has their own board for their gangster head, which shows their abilities, recruitment, and player levels and score. The other side is the same but with a special unique ability, meaning players can play a simpler or more complex game.

After five rounds, the player who has gained the most notoriety in the city wins the game.
user summary

Name: Reise durch die Schweiz
Description:
The players start at space 1 in Schaffhausen. The first to arrive in Lindau at space 50 wins the game. Movement is determined by the roll of a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Contains 6 metal player pieces.  Published before 1928 based on publisher location on cover.

Name: The Bells Toll for Madrid: Franco´s Offensive against Madrid, Oct-Nov 1936
Description:
The Bells Toll for Madrid is a two player free PnP game simulating the advance of Franco´s rebel forces aiming to capture Madrid in the early stages of the Spanish Civil War 1936/39.

The game includes a rules set, 192 two sided counters and an A2 (17”x 22”) map; all components will be made available in the files section of this page. Only a six sided die needs to be provided.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Built for War: Solo/AI module
Description: This deck of cards adds the ability to play solo and with AI for smaller player counts!

Name: Sommarlov: Jakten på Sommarskuggan
Description:
Welcome to Summer Holiday!

All players draw a card without showing it to the others. One of the players will be the Summer Shadow!

The idea of the game is to capture the "shadow". If the Summer Shadow manages to run off the playing field before those who chase, that player wins. If not, the player who catches the Summer Shadow wins.

The hunters can gain extra speed by completing various missions. The summer shade, on the other hand, can hinder the hunters by releasing a little shadow slime that delays the hunt.

Many of the tasks are solved together by several players.

Välkommen till Sommarlov!

Alla spelarna drar ett kort utan att visa för de andra. En av spelarna kommer att bli Sommarskuggan!

Idén med spelet är att ta fast skuggan. Hinner Sommarskuggan springa av spelplanen före de som jagar så vinner den spelaren. Om inte så vinner spelaren som hinner ifatt Sommarskuggan.

De jagande kan få extra fart genom att klara olika uppdrag. Sommarskuggan å sin sida kan hindra jagarna genom att släppa lite skuggslem som fördröjer jakten.

Många av uppgifterna löses tillsammans av flera spelare.

Name: PARKS: Wildlife
Description:
Expand the award-winning game Parks with Parks: Wildlife! Grab your binoculars and prepare for even more animal sightings at Iconic Wildlife Parks, featuring all-new artwork from Tom Whalen and the Fifty-Nine Parks Print Series, and the newest national park addition, New River Gorge. This expansion is the MORE expansion. Get ready for new trail sites, fresh canteens, new gear, and more season cards.

Wildlife also introduces a large wandering Bison that moves along the park cards and grants bonuses to the players that visit those parks.

—description from the publisher

Name: Viva La Dungeon!: Level One
Description:
People from all over the realm come to the Dungeon with the hopes of winning gold, magic and glory. They are not heroes. They are not trained. They do not have supernatural powers. And only one of them is going to survive.

Viva La Dungeon! is a battle-royal dungeon-crawling game of hidden movement, treasure-looting and player versus player combat for up to 4 players.

Players move around the Dungeon, finding equipment, and finding each other to pick-pocket or fight while the Gelatinous Cubes slowly make the map smaller and smaller.

Based off the live Twitch game show, Viva La Dungeon brings the chaotic fun of the livestream to your family's game table.

—description from the publisher

Name: Klostermust
Description:
Klostermust is a family game, or light weight strategy game with both luck and a lot of tactics.  Klostermust uses dice and action drafting as its core mechanics.

The game takes place in a monastery, where you play as monks and nuns who compete to collect apples and make soft apple cider. The goal of the game is to impress the bishop who will visit the monastery on the seventh day and mark the end of the game. 
To be successful you need a fair bit of tactics but also a bit of luck.

The game is published in Sweden.

Name: アドテール (Adtale)
Description:
ã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒ†ãƒ¼ãƒ« (Adtale) is a dice game from Japan in which players direct red and green slime against each other.

Each player rolls dice and chooses a suitable attack card to be used with that dice. They all send their red and greeen dice and cards out together, to form a mass of slime in the middle of the players' area. As the mass of slime builds up by accumulating more dice, the slime is forced around, until it finally impacts on a player.

By using the combination of player abilities, dice abilities and dice, players try to eliminate the opposition before they succumb to attacks themselves.
user summary

Name: CATAN: 3D Expansions – Seafarers + Cities & Knights
Description:
CATAN: 3D Expansions – Seafarers + Cities & Knights features two expansions to use with CATAN: 3D Edition that bring new — yet familiar — experiences to the table.

In CATAN – Seafarers, you send ships to explore uncharted islands to build new settlements and discover valuable gold.

In CATAN: Cities & Knights, you develop cities and join forces with your neighboring factions to defend Catan against ruthless barbarians!

—description from the publisher
